In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(wrapped_text)
            wrapped_text *= " "
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= word
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.", 30))
```

This will output:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,\nconsectetur adipiscing elit.\nSed do eiusmod tempor\nincididunt ut labore et dolore magna\naliqua."
```
